DOC.brief_summary: This crossover, glucose-clamp study will investigate the impact of different basal insulin infusion rates on glucose control employing insulin pumps with different insulin delivery regimen. Patients will be randomized in one of 2 groups, to receive on the first study day insulin via pumps with pulsatile or quasi-continuous delivery modes. On the second study day they will be switched to treatment with the alternative delivery regimen. The anticipated duration of the trial is 2 study days and the target sample size is 14 individuals.
DOC.brief_title: A Monocenter, Open-Label Glucose Clamp Study Examining the Metabolic Effect of Insulin Infusion Intervals for Basal Insulin Infusion in Patients With Type I Diabetes
DOC.criteria: Male patients 1865 years of age Type I diabetes mellitus Currently on continuous subcutaneous insulin infusion therapy Proliferative retinopathy or maculopathy requiring actue treatment within last 6 months Use of systemic corticoids in last 3 months Treatment with medication known to interfere with glucose metabolism
